item.title: Dunjungle launches December 11 for PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Physical editions available via PM Studios and Meridiem Games.

Side-scrolling roguelite action game Dunjungle will leave early Access and launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam on December 11, publisher Astrolabe Games and developer Patapez Interactive announced. A demo is available now for PlayStation 5 and Switch, with more platforms to follow.

Dunjungle first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam on October 22, 2024.

A physical edition of the game will be released day and date with the digital edition, distributed by PM Studios in North America and Meridiem Games in Europe.

Here is an overview of the game, via Astrolabe Games:

About

Dunjungle is an action-packed roguelite about an ape, adventuring into a jungle under the menace of a corruptive power that is transforming its peaceful creatures and destroying everything on its way.

You’ll explore continuously changing dungeons, temples, crypts, and other mysterious places, where you’ll find all sort of weird enemies and an arsenal of weapons, spells, and relics, granting you a different experience every time you play.

Not all creatures are hostile! Along your way, you may find characters who are lost, trapped, or maybe just chilling in there. Help them out, and you might become friends!

(Spoiler: A lot of them are monkeys.)

Fast Game Loop

There are no checkpoints in Dunjungle. You die, you start over. Die again, try again. No hassle!

And don’t worry too much! Several things will remain for your next run.
Maybe you unlocked a new weapon? Maybe a new spell? Maybe you saved a trapped character, who will now lend you a hand.

More importantly, each time you die, you’ll know more about Dunjungle’s world, so don’t despair, and use what you’ve learned to get further on your next adventure!

Key Features

  • Lots of weapons, spells and relics with unique effects.
  • Weapons and spells can also be merged with several elements, to create new and powerful versions. Burn monsters with fire, use ice to slow them down, shock them with thunder, or just get them off you using wind to blow them away!
  • Dungeons are procedurally generated, made from big collection of hand-crafted rooms. These rooms are filled with all sort of weird creatures, valuable treasures, dangerous traps, and of course, challenging bosses!

And More!

  • Monkeys!
  • Pixel art!
  • Irrelevant item descriptions!
  • Annoying NPCs who think they’re better than you!
  • Weird fishes with legs!
  • Treasure chests that are actually not treasure chests!

Watch a new trailer below.

Consoles Announce and Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/dunjungle-launches-december-11-for-ps5-xbox-series-ps4-switch-and-pc

item.title: Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2 adds Lasombra and Toreador clans to base game; ‘Overview’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Story Packs planned for release in 2026.

Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2 will ship with the Lasombra and Toreador clans available in the base game, publishers Paradox Interactive and White Wolf, and developer The Chinese Room announced. Both were previously planned as day one paid downloadable content.

The companies also announced plans for two additional Story Packs, “Loose Cannon” and “The Flower & the Flame,” which will allow players to explore Seattle through the perspectives of Camarilla Sheriff Benny Muldoon and Primogen Ysabella Moore, respectively. Both are planned for release in 2026, and are included in the Premium Edition’s Expansion Pass.

“Thanks to our community for the frank feedback on Bloodlines 2 and the Premium Edition,” said White Wolf executive vice president and Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2 executive producer Marco Behrmann in a press release. “That feedback made it clear: Lasombra and Toreador belong in the base game, so that is what we are doing. We’d also like to thank The Chinese Room for their quick turnaround on the concepts for the post-launch Story Packs. We’re constantly impressed by their creativity and skill in weaving enticing narrative threads that expand on the main story in Bloodlines 2.”

Get the latest details below.

Digital Editions

  • Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2 Deluxe Edition ($69.99 / £58.50 / €69.99) – Base game and “Santa Monica Memories,” a cosmetic pack launching on day one, featuring decor items inspired by the original cult classic Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines to adorn Phyre’s in-game apartment.
    • “Santa Monica Memories” can be purchased separately for $11.99 / £9.99 / €11.99.
  • Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2 Premium Edition ($89.99 / £74.99 / €89.99)- Base game and the Expansion Pass featuring “Santa Monica Memories,” “Loose Cannon,” and “The Flower & the Flame” Story Packs.
    • “Santa Monica Memories,” a cosmetic pack launching on day one, featuring decor items inspired by the original cult classic Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines to adorn Phyre’s in-game apartment.
      • “Santa Monica Memories” can be purchased separately for $11.99 / £9.99 / €11.99.
    • “Loose Cannon” follows Brujah Sheriff Benny’s brutal perspective, letting players experience his story of relentless pursuit. Players who purchase will also unlock a Benny-inspired outfit for Phyre when Loose Cannon launches.
      • Loose Cannon launches in Q2 2026 and can be purchased separately for $14.99 / £12.99 / €14.99.
    • “The Flower & the Flame” follows Toreador Primogen Ysabella’s legendary path to creating her dark magnum opus. Players who own “The Flower & the Flame” will also get a Ysabella-inspired outfit for Phyre when the story pack launches.
      • “The Flower & the Flame” launches in Q3 2026 and can be purchased separately for SRP $14.99/£12.99/€14.99.
  • The Expansion Pass can be purchased separately on October 21, 2025 for SRP $34.99 / £28.99 / €34.99.

Physical Editions

  • Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2 Day One Edition ($59.99 / £49.99 / €59.99) – Includes the base game and the Bloodlines Nostalgia Jukebox pre-order bonus. Select retailers will also have a physical necklace inspired by the Cross of St. James.
  • Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2 Premium Edition ($89.99 / £74.99 / €89.99) – Includes the base game, Bloodlines Nostalgia Jukebox pre-order bonus, the Expansion Pass, five character cards, a journal, and a Steelbook case, all packaged in a premium box.
    • Contents of the physical Premium Edition are subject to regional availability. Limited quantities are available.

About the Game

Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2 players will experience nine nights in Seattle as Elder vampire Phyre, navigating the treacherous politics of the Camarilla Court and reclaiming their full vampiric powers. Along the way, Phyre is haunted and guided by the voice of Fabien, a Malkavian detective whose fractured perception of reality offers both insight and unease.

The story continues with the Story Packs, each centering on a key Camarilla character from Phyre’s journey: Sheriff Benny and Primogen Ysabella. These packs deepen Phyre’s story and reveal Seattle’s World of Darkness through their eyes, offering fresh insights into their motivations and new angles on the city’s hidden power struggles.

Players can choose one of six clans in the base game, each with its own distinct playstyles, outfits, and Disciplines: the rebellious Brujah, blood sorcery masters Tremere, justice-driven Banu Haqim, the persuasive Ventrue, the enthralling Toreador, and the shadow master Lasombra. Players must remain mindful of their surroundings or risk breaking the Masquerade—the absolute law of secrecy that keeps vampire society hidden from humanity.

Vampire: The Masquerade – Bloodlines 2 is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and GOG.

Watch a new trailer below.

Overview Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/09/vampire-the-masquerade-bloodlines-2-adds-lasombra-and-toreador-clans-to-base-game-overview-trailer
